description: The UCO Institute of Hope Scholarship is awarded to students facing financial hardship, abuse, or extenuating circumstances as they try to reach their educational goals. It was created by three Sociology alumnae to fight prejudice, poverty, and abuse through educational programming and flexible student financial aid. Eligibility Requirements Preference given to Liberal Arts majors Must be U.S. Resident/Citizen Evidence of student's commitment to their education through GPA or academic progress from past semesters Enrolled in a minimum of 6 hours in the semester awarded Provide a detailed statement explaining financial need, any special circumstances facing past or current poverty, abuse, or extenuating issues, and additional information or comments

general_criteria.description: Soft requirements that provide additional points/consideration

hard_criteria.description: Hard requirements that must be met to qualify for the scholarship
